pageContext.claim: “Don't forget, the Democrats have ruled the inner cities for 100 years.”
pageContext.analysis: The "inner city" is not a geographic location, but rather a code word for areas within cities with a large population of low-income black and Latino people. That being said, several major cities have had Republican mayors in recent years. Rudy Giuliani, a Republican, was Mayor of New York City from 1994-2001. As Mayor he "ruled" both the "inner city" as well as the rest of New York.
